messages.title: Former Green Convenor, Robin Harper backs Ian
messages.content: My party has decided not to stand a candidate in this unnecessary election for several reasons. For myself, as a Unionist as well as a Green, I have little option now but to vote Labour or Liberal. Ian Murray and I have worked together and he has struck me as a first class MP. I called him one of Scotland’s finest politicians; I would be very happy on his return to parliament to carry on his work for his constituents and Scotland. I am more than happy to endorse him for a very sensible and hard working MP.

messages.title: NO to a second independence referendum
messages.content: Nicola Sturgeon and the SNP will use this election, as they have used Brexit, as a way to secure independence. In Edinburgh South, we have a chance to send a clear message: we do not want another referendum. It is not the right path and will only increase division and uncertainty.

messages.title: Standing up against a hard Brexit
messages.content: I’ve been fighting tirelessly against a hard Brexit: both in Parliament, when I voted against triggering Article 50, and locally where I campaigned for Remain. We now need to ensure the best possible deal for the UK but can’t give Theresa May a blank cheque.

messages.title: Fighting for equality and better public services
messages.content: For too long the constitution has dominated political conversations in Scotland. Our cherished public services have suffered as a result – whether education or the NHS under the SNP, or Tory austerity cuts. I’ll continue to fight for equality and better public services.

messages.title: My record of local service
messages.content:
Here for you - The most responsive MP in Scotland. Independent charity MySociety rated me as the most responsive MP in Scotland and 15th of all 650 MPs in the UK.
Here to help - Over 1,000 advice sessions. Since I was elected, I’ve held over 1,000 advice sessions and taken on over 14,000 cases from constituents who needed my help.
Always in touch - Not just at election time. I have tried my hardest to ensure you are informed about my activities – whether through my regular newsletters, surveys, Coffee Mornings or public meetings.
Always available - Every household every year. Ever since I was elected, I’ve been visiting every household in Edinburgh South every single year. I know our streets, our communities and our services.
You are my boss - Standing up for you. In 2015, I defeated the SNP candidate by just 2,637 votes, while the Conservatives trailed by over 10,500. Despite spurious graphs, either result is a clear choice between me and the SNP here in Edinburgh South.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: NO to a second independence referendum
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Sending a clear message against another independence referendum, deeming it the wrong path that will increase division and uncertainty.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Standing up against a hard Brexit
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Fighting against a hard Brexit in Parliament and locally, ensuring the best possible deal for the UK without giving Theresa May a blank cheque.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Fighting for equality and better public services
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Opposing cuts to education and the NHS by the SNP and Tory austerity measures, advocating for equality and better public services.
